<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.76

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Arrays

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>Returns a random element from the given array according to assigned weights. Engine solution to [[BIS_fnc_selectRandomWeighted]]. A few notes:
* Negative weights are not supported
* If an item's weight is 0, the item is ignored
* The weights don't have to total to 1 
* If numbers of items and weights do not match, the shortest array is used
* A single array Syntax is slightly faster then Alt Syntax

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value>'''selectRandomWeighted''' valuesAndWeights

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> valuesAndWeights: [[Array]] - array in format [value1, weight1, value2, weight2...], where:<span>
* value: [[Anything]] - weighted value
* weight: [[Number]] - values relative weight
</span>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Anything]] - random weighted value or [[Nothing]] if array is empty or all weights are 0

</value></part><part><name>s2 </name>=<value> values '''selectRandomWeighted''' weights

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> values: [[Array]] - array of [[Anything]]
</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> weights: [[Array]] - array of [[Number]]s

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Anything]] - random weighted value or [[Nothing]] if any of arrays is empty or all weights are 0
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_randomWeightedElement = [[selectRandomWeighted]] [1,0.1,2,0.2,3,1.3,4,2.4,5,7.5];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_randomWeightedElement = [1,2,3,4,5] [[selectRandomWeighted]] [0.1,0.2,1.3,2.4,7.5];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[random]], [[select]], [[selectRandom]], [[selectMin]], [[selectMax]]
</value></part></template>
